metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27135 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
xterm before Patch #366 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a crafted UTF-8 combining character sequence.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xterm - 353-1ubuntu1.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xterm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '353-1ubuntu1.20.04.2').
